summary: public health practitioners have implemented new syndromic and other advanced surveillance systems to supplement their existing laboratory testing and disease surveillance toolkit. the global emergence of influenza A H7N9, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and other novel influenza A viruses, emphasize the importance of maintaining vigilance for the presence of emerging disease. most jurisdictions struggle to determine which surveillance systems provide the most cost-effective data in response to decreasing funding. final survey responses and subsequent recommendations will be presented at a future PHPC meeting.
